name: The Kiss Hello Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What does Jerry need to open for his Nana in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Ketchup.

	Jerry gets a call from his Nana shortly before going to lunch with George.  Jerry comments on how his Nana seems to be getting more and more frail at her old age and George seems to think that ketchup never comes in squeeze bottles.  His suggestion: it should be sold in tubes, like toothpaste.

questions.text: George has a problem with a swelling on his leg.
questions.explanation:
False.

	When walking down the street with George, Jerry runs into Elaine and her friend, Wendy.  George learns that Wendy is a physical therapist and takes the opportunity to ask her about a swelling on his arm.  Jerry hates the idea that every time he talks to Wendy, he has to give a kiss hello to her.

1962.

	When Jerry arrives at his Nana's, Uncle Leo is also there since he got a call to open the ketchup.  They argue for a while over it and Nana starts talking about something that happened more than thirty years earlier.  She asks Leo if he gave his sister (Jerry's mom) $50 from the money that their father won at the track and Uncle Leo denies that he owes Helen money.

questions.text: What feature of Wendy's does Elaine not like?
questions.explanation:
Her hair.

	At Monk's, Jerry and Elaine talk about the way that Wendy's hair looks, and they find that it's similar to an old high school yearbook picture.  They decide to bring Wendy to Jerry's apartment so that Kramer can instantly tell her what he thinks about it.  This backfires since Kramer thinks it looks good on her.

questions.text: How does Kramer get a picture of Jerry?
questions.correct: He takes one with his camera
options: He finds one in an album
He gets one sent in by Jerry's parents
questions.explanation:
He takes one with his camera.

	Kramer has a new idea to get pictures of everyone in the building and put them up in the lobby so that everyone knows each other's names.  Jerry doesn't like the idea and refuses to give Kramer a picture, but Kramer goes ahead anyways and takes one.  The picture is a funny shot of Jerry looking surprised at the camera.

questions.text: On which day did George cancel his appointment with Wendy?
questions.explanation:
Tuesday.

	After visiting Wendy, George finds that his arm feels a lot better and he pays the perky receptionist.  The receptionist informs George that he actually needs to pay $150 instead since he canceled his appointment on Tuesday.  According to their policy, he needs to give 24 hours notice on all canceled appointments.

questions.text: What is the name of the woman in Jerry's building that asks him to help her with a package?
questions.explanation:
Mary.

	As soon as Kramer puts up the pictures, Jerry starts having conversations with other residents of the building.  He doesn't like the idea of having conversations with fellow tenants, but everyone else loves the plan.  After talking to Mary, he agrees to help her with a package, and she gives him a kiss.  Now, Jerry feels obligated to always give her a kiss.  Soon, Jerry is getting kisses hello from all of the female tenants of the building.

questions.text: Who puts Jerry's Nana into a retirement home?
questions.explanation:
Uncle Leo.

	As soon as he gets the news, Jerry assumes that Uncle Leo placed Nana into a retirement home to prevent her from letting out more of his childhood information.  After this, Jerry tells Kramer that he's no longer giving anyone in the building a kiss hello since he doesn't want to feel the pressure of having to do it.

questions.text: After skiing, how far away from Elaine's apartment does Wendy drop her off?
questions.explanation:
Three blocks.

	Wendy decides to take a day off from work to go skiing with Elaine, but when they get back to New York, Wendy drops her off three blocks away from her apartment since she doesn't want to drive around Central Park.  Elaine ends up dragging her skis and equipment down the street and she hurts her shoulder.  George is also affected by this.  Wendy ends up canceling their appointment, but George feels that he should've had 24 hours notice.

questions.text: What is the name of the man that lived next door to Jerry's Nana?
questions.explanation:
Buddy.

	When Jerry checks on his Nana at the nursing home, a nurse says that his Nana reunited with her old neighbour, Buddy.  After talking to him, he realizes that Leo really did owe the money.  Meanwhile, George finds out about Wendy's skiing trip when Elaine goes in for an appointment.  Elaine doesn't get her treatment because she has no insurance, and she tells Wendy what she thinks about her hair.  When Jerry returns to his apartment, no one wants him around, and he starts to feel horrible.
